statements.name: PROC GEOCODE
statements.description: Identifies the data set that contains the address data that you want to geocode and can identify a lookup data set. You can also specify an output data set, the geocoding method, alternate names for geocoding variables, and additional attribute variables to associate with the matched addresses.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: specifies the SAS data set that contains address observations that you want to geocode.

arguments.name: ADDRESSCITYVAR=
arguments.description: specifies the character variable in the input address data set that contains the city names.

arguments.name: ADDRESSCOUNTRYVAR=
arguments.description: specifies the character variable in the input address data set that contains the country name or identifier for international CITY geocoding.

arguments.name: ADDRESSPLUS4VAR=
arguments.description: specifies the variable in the input address data set that contains ZIP+4 extensions.

arguments.name: ADDRESSSTATEVAR=
arguments.description: specifies the character variable in the input address data set that contains the two-character postal abbreviation for each state or province.

arguments.name: ADDRESSVAR=
arguments.description: specifies the address variable for STREET, CUSTOM, or RANGE geocoding.

arguments.name: ADDRESSZIPVAR=
arguments.description: specifies the variable in the input address data set that contains the five-digit ZIP code values or non-U.S. postcode values.

arguments.name: ATTRIBUTEVAR=
arguments.description: lists non-geocoding variables in the lookup data set that are to be added to the output data set.

arguments.name: BEGINRANGEVAR=
arguments.description: specifies the numeric variable in your range data set that contains the beginning IP address for each range of addresses.

arguments.name: DIRECTION=
arguments.description: specifies an alternate data set of street direction names.

arguments.name: ENDRANGEVAR=
arguments.description: specifies the numeric variable in your range data set that contains the ending IP address for each range of addresses.

arguments.name: LOOKUP=
arguments.description: specifies a SAS data set that associates coordinates with addresses for specific geocoding methods.

arguments.name: LOOKUPCITY=
arguments.description: specifies the city matching data set for associating coordinates with addresses when performing CITY geocoding.

arguments.name: LOOKUPCITYVAR=
arguments.description: specifies the character variable in the lookup data set that contains the city names.

arguments.name: LOOKUPCOUNTRYVAR=
arguments.description: specifies the character variable in the lookup data set that contains the country name or identifier.

arguments.name: LOOKUPKEYVAR=
arguments.description: specifies the key variable for the lookup data set that links into the RANGE data set.

arguments.name: LOOKUPLATVAR=
arguments.description: specifies the numeric variable in the lookup data set that contains the latitude of the geocoded location.

arguments.name: LOOKUPLONGVAR=
arguments.description: specifies the numeric variable in the lookup data set that contains the longitude of the geocoded location.

arguments.name: LOOKUPPLUS4VAR=
arguments.description: specifies the variable in the lookup address data set that contains ZIP+4 extensions.

arguments.name: LOOKUPSTATEVAR=
arguments.description: specifies the character variable in the lookup data set that contains the two-character postal abbreviation for the states or provinces.

arguments.name: LOOKUPSTREET=
arguments.description: specifies the street matching data set for associating coordinates with addresses when performing STREET geocoding.

arguments.name: LOOKUPVAR=
arguments.description: specifies the variable in the lookup data set that contains non-address values used for geocoding with CUSTOM regions.

arguments.name: LOOKUPXVAR=
arguments.description: specifies the numeric variable in the lookup data set that contains the longitude of the geocoded location.

arguments.name: LOOKUPYVAR=
arguments.description: specifies the numeric variable in the lookup data set that contains the latitude of the geocoded location.

arguments.name: LOOKUPZIPVAR=
arguments.description: specifies the variable in the lookup data set that contains the five-digit ZIP code values or the non-U.S. postcode values.

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: specifies the primary geocoding method.

arguments.name: CITY
arguments.description: specifies the CITY geocoding method. The GEOCODE procedure attempts to match certain variables from your address data set with the lookup data set. The procedure uses city and state variables for U.S. city matching, and city and country variables for world city matching. When using a world city lookup data set, you have the option of specifying a state or province variable to help the procedure match cities. A _MATCHED_ value of State mismatch indicates that the geocoder found a city and country match but the state or province name was not matched. Separate city, country, and state variables are required in the address and lookup data sets.

arguments.name: CUSTOM
arguments.description: specifies the CUSTOM geocoding method. The GEOCODE procedure attempts to match custom variables that you specify by using the LOOKUPVAR= and ADDRESSVAR= options. Examples of custom variables include internal sales territories and Metropolitan Statistical Areas (MSA).

arguments.name: PLUS4
arguments.description: specifies the PLUS4 geocoding method. The GEOCODE procedure attempts to match the five-digit ZIP code and ZIP+4 extension from your address data set with the lookup data set.

arguments.name: RANGE
arguments.description: specifies the RANGE geocoding method. The GEOCODE procedure attempts to match an IP address from your address data set to a range of IP addresses from the range data set. If a match is found, then a key variable is used to match the IP address to a set of coordinates in the lookup data set.

arguments.name: STREET
arguments.description: specifies the STREET geocoding method. The GEOCODE procedure first attempts to match the street name and ZIP or postal code. If no match is found, then the GEOCODE procedure attempts to match the street name, city name, and two-character state abbreviation or full state name. If the second match fails, then the ZIP method and the CITY method are used instead.

arguments.name: ZIP
arguments.description: specifies the ZIP code geocoding method. The GEOCODE procedure attempts to match the five-digit ZIP code or non-U.S. postal code from your address data set with the lookup data set. If no match is found, then the CITY method is used instead.

arguments.name: NOCITY
arguments.description: disables the secondary matching attempt using the CITY geocoding method when STREET or ZIP code geocoding does not find a match.

arguments.name: NOSTIMER
arguments.description: disables the informational messages sent to the SAS log that tracks the progress of the geocoding operation.

arguments.name: NOZIP
arguments.description: disables the secondary matching attempt using the ZIP geocoding method when PLUS4 or STREET geocoding does not find a match.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: specifies a data set for the geocoded addresses.

arguments.name: RANGEDATA=
arguments.description: specifies a data set that associates ranges of IPv4 addresses with locations.

arguments.name: RANGEDECIMAL
arguments.description: specifies that the values of the ADDRESSVAR= variable are in decimal or hexadecimal format.

arguments.name: RANGEKEYVAR=
arguments.description: specifies the key variable for the IPv4 range data set.

arguments.name: STATE=
arguments.description: specifies a SAS data set that is used by the STREET geocoding method to equate state or province postal abbreviations with complete names.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: specifies a SAS data set that is used by the STREET geocoding method to standardize common street address elements.
